definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: First, please study Hiragana and Katakana.
sentences.chinese: 首先，請學習平假名和片假名。

sentences.english: Sorry I use hiragana. I never study kanji.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉我用平假名，我從沒學過日文漢字。

sentences.english: The resulting designs were then called "hiaragana".
sentences.chinese: 設計的結果就是後來被稱爲“平假名”。

sentences.english: True, there isn't any Hiragana and Katakana here, but that is NO REASON to attack her.
sentences.chinese: 沒有平假名或片假名在這裏，但沒有理由攻擊她。

definition: reading or phonetic value of a character
false name/pseudonym/alias/pen name/the Japanese kana scripts/hiragana 平假名[ping2 jia3 ming2] and katakana 片假名[pian4 jia3 ming2]
Mandarin phonetic symbols (MPS), phonetic alphabet for Chinese used esp. in Taiwan, also known colloquially as Bopomofo (after the first four letters of the alphabet:ㄅㄆㄇㄈ)
Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
native words (i.e. not derived from Chinese, in Korean and Japanese etc)
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
to indicate the pronunciation of Chinese characters using Pinyin or Bopomofo etc/phonetic notation/(specifically) Bopomofo (abbr. for 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4])
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
